body_html:
@yongtang If I understand correctly, --define with_kafka_support=true or TF_NEED_KAFKA=1 is equivalent to specifying y in Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Apache Kafka Platform support? [y/N], so it should be working.
I don't think tensorflow picks up the cpp kernel properly. I tried adding the kernel itself to the contrib BUILD but to no success.
body_text:
@yongtang If I understand correctly, --define with_kafka_support=true or TF_NEED_KAFKA=1 is equivalent to specifying y in Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Apache Kafka Platform support? [y/N], so it should be working.
I don't think tensorflow picks up the cpp kernel properly. I tried adding the kernel itself  to the contrib BUILD but to no success.
body:
@yongtang If I understand correctly, `--define with_kafka_support=true` or `TF_NEED_KAFKA=1` is equivalent to specifying `y` in `Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Apache Kafka Platform support? [y/N]`, so it should be working.
I don't think tensorflow picks up the cpp kernel properly. I tried adding the [kernel](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.6/tensorflow/contrib/kafka/BUILD#L15) itself  to the contrib [BUILD](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.6/tensorflow/contrib/BUILD) but to no success.
